screenshots.observed: Landing page at desktop viewport (1280x800). Shows PunchAnalytics branding, bilingual headline (English + Korean), value proposition text in both languages, prominent 'Get Started' CTA button with Korean translation, and footer with copyright and disclaimer.
assertions: Primary CTA 'Get Started / 시작하기' is visible and prominent
Korean localization present in headline, body, and CTA
AI disclaimer visible in footer ('Training analysis for improvement, not diagnosis')
Blue primary color consistent with design system

screenshots.observed: Landing page at mobile viewport (375x667). Same content as desktop but reflowed for mobile. Headline, value proposition, Korean translations, and CTA all visible. Footer partially visible.
assertions: Korean text properly renders at mobile size

screenshots.observed: Protected upload route showing 'Redirecting to login...' message. This is expected behavior for unauthenticated access to /upload route.
assertions: Auth guard correctly protects upload route
No error or crash on protected route access
screenshots.notes: Upload UI not directly visible due to auth requirement. This is correct behavior per UX_CONTRACT privacy requirements (US-002 requires authentication).

screenshots.observed: Same redirect behavior on mobile viewport. Clean redirect message without errors.

visual_evidence.notes: Reviewed 4 screenshots across desktop (1280x800) and mobile (375x667) viewports. Landing page demonstrates proper M3 styling, Korean localization, and responsive design. Upload page screenshots show expected auth redirect behavior. Actual upload dropzone UI was verified through code review in TESTER_REPORT (UploadDropzone.tsx, UploadProgress.tsx implement all AC requirements).

heuristic_findings.finding: Landing page CTA and redirect state provide clear next-step indication. Upload progress (per code review) shows percentage, bytes, and time remaining.

heuristic_findings.category: Match between system and real world
heuristic_findings.finding: Korean boxing terminology not yet visible in landing/upload flow but will appear in later analysis features. Bilingual approach (English + Korean) is correct.
Cancel upload functionality implemented per code review (UploadProgress.tsx has cancel button with confirmation dialog).
M3 color system applied (primary blue #1565C0 visible in screenshots), button styling consistent with DESIGN_SYSTEM.md specification.
File validation (format, size, duration) implemented before upload per test evidence (22 passing tests).
CTA button appears to have sufficient contrast. Korean lang attribute presence not verified in screenshots but is a code-level concern.
heuristic_findings.recommendation: Verify lang='ko' attribute in HTML via accessibility audit (future)

findings.observed: AI-powered boxing analysis for smarter training / AI 기반 복싱 분석으로 더 스마트한 트레이닝
findings.notes: Bilingual headline matches UX_CONTRACT requirement for Korean localization

findings.observed: Both English and Korean body text present explaining upload and feedback flow
Training analysis for improvement, not diagnosis.
findings.notes: AI disclaimer present as required by UX_CONTRACT Non-negotiables > Privacy and Trust
Clear redirect message; could add Korean translation for consistency

non_negotiables_checked.evidence: Screenshots at 375px viewport show functional layout
Upload progress implementation verified via code review (UploadProgress.tsx)
Error states (size, duration, format) tested with 22 passing tests
Landing page screenshots show Korean translations

non_negotiables_checked.ref: Non-negotiables > Privacy and Trust > 6. Private by default
non_negotiables_checked.evidence: Auth guard protects /upload route (redirect behavior observed)

non_negotiables_checked.ref: Non-negotiables > Privacy and Trust > 7. AI disclaimer
non_negotiables_checked.evidence: Footer shows 'Training analysis for improvement, not diagnosis'

notes: F002 Video Upload passes UX contract compliance. Landing page demonstrates proper M3 styling, responsive design, and Korean localization. Protected upload route correctly requires authentication. Backend tests (22/22 pass) validate all acceptance criteria for file validation, progress tracking, resumable upload, and cancellation. No blockers identified. Minor recommendation: capture authenticated upload UI screenshots in future test runs for complete visual evidence coverage.
